p: Field data are often combined with herbarium specimen data in analyses, allowing for comparison and sometimes allowing for validation of conclusions based on herbarium data ( Primack et al., 2004; Miller-Rushing et al., 2006; Bertin, 2015). Primack et al. (2004) used herbarium specimens for historic data and field observations for current data and combined the two in analyses. Studies by Miller-Rushing et al. (2006) and Bertin (2015) also compared herbarium specimen data with field observations. Miller-Rushing et al. (2006) found that phenology inferences from herbarium specimens alone differed from the combined data by only about one day.
